tool.name: ProfRep
tool.description: Tool to identify and visualize general repetive profile of a sequence as well as assign repetitive regions to a class from database of repeats

param.name: prepared_dataset
param.label: Choose existing annotation dataset
param.help: You can find list of all available species below in the Database section

param.name: reads
param.label: NGS reads
param.help: Input file of fasta-formatted reads sequences

param.name: cls
param.label: RE list of clusters and belonging reads (hitsort.cls)
param.help: fasta-formatted list of all clusters reported by RE and reads identifiers that belong to them

param.name: annotations
param.label: Clusters classification
param.help: Table containing numbers of clusters and corresponding classifications

param.name: genome_size
param.label: Enter the genome size in Mbp

param.name: e_value
param.label: e-value cut-off
param.help: Blast filtering option: statistical significance threshold for reporting hits

param.name: word_size
param.label: Initial word size
param.help: Initial word size used by Blast for alignment

param.name: dust_filter
param.label: Use DUST filter
param.help: Filters query sequence for low-complexity regions with DUST filter

param.name: window
param.label: Sliding window size
param.help: Use when having a long input sequence so that it can be processed in parallel

param.name: overlap
param.label: Windows overlap
param.help: Must be greater than read length

param.name: threshold
param.label: Repetitive threshold
param.help: Threshold for copy numbers/hits at certain position to be reported as repetitive in GFF format

data.label: GFF file of unspecified bases (N) from dataset ${input.hid}

tool.help:
**HELP**
**Input data**
1. list of NGS reads [RE archive: seqclust -> sequences -> sequences.fasta] 2. list of all clusters and belonging reads [RE archive: seqclust -> clustering -> hitsort.cls] 3. clusters classification table [RE archive: PROFREP_CLASSIFICATION_TEMPLATE.csv (**! automatic classification - needs to be manually inspected**)]
*REQUIREMENTS for custom classification table:*
TAB-separated list of cluster numbers and their repetitive classification. The list does not have to necessarily contain all the clusters. Classification may be an arbitrary custom string, but it is highly desirable to use the standardized format, especially for downstream analysis of the output (ProfRep Refiner Tool):
- individual classification levels are separated by a pipe character "|" - the first classification level is derived from the origin of the repetitive sequence, i.e. repeat, organelle. - mobile elements classification should follow protein domains classification - for the rest of repeats (e.g. satellites, MITEs) arbitrary custom classification with any number of levels is allowed
Example::
42 repeat|mobile_element|Class_I|LTR|Ty1/copia|SIRE 43 repeat|mobile_element|Class_I|LTR|Ty3/gypsy|non-chromovirus|OTA|Ogre/Tat|TatIV/Ogre 45 repeat|mobile_element|Class_I|LTR|Ty3/gypsy|non-chromovirus|OTA|Athila 48 repeat|satellite|PisTR/B 134 organelle|plastid
All the files are available from RE clustering archive. For Galaxy manipulation you can use **'Extract Data for Profrep'** tool to easily extract them. For selected species these files will already be available as prepared datasets - at present this option is only available for Pisum sativum Terno (Macas et al 2015))
**Principle**
The main ProfRep tool runs Blast+ similarity search on given DNA against the database of all reads (low coverage sequencing). The reported hits are filtered to get only the ones with significant similarity and appropriate length. These and other search parameters are all adjustable (Advanced options in Galaxy formular). The similarity search runs in parallel which lowers the computing times significantly especially when working with large input data - it defaultly uses all the sources available. The parallelization sliding window is set to 5kb with 150b overlap, but both parameters are adjustable. When changing them, make sure that the overlap is at least of reads length so that the hits on borders are covered. The hits for every position are recorded and classified based on to which cluster the corresponding read belongs. The summed profile ALL is created based on all individual profiles plus profiles of all mapped (but unclustered or unclassified) reads, keeping track of the overal sequence representation of repeats. Protein domains search is accomplished by DANTE, running defaultly as a ProfRep module (can be switched off). The reported domains are quality filtered.
**Outputs**
- **HTML summary report, JBrowse Data Directory** showing basic information and repetitive profile graphs as well as protein domains (optional) for individual sequences (up to 50). This output also serves as an data directory for [JBrowse](https://jbrowse.org/) genome browser. You can create a standalone JBrowse instance for further detailed visualization of the output tracks using Galaxy-integrated tool. This output can also be downloaded as an archive containing all relevant data for visualization via locally installed JBrowse server (see more about visualization in OUTPUT VISUALIZATION below) - **Ns GFF** - reports unspecified (N) bases regions in the sequence - **Repeats GFF** - reports repetitive regions of a certain length (defaultly **80**) and above hits/copy numbers threshold (defaultly **5**) - **Domains GFF** - reports protein domains, classification of domain, chain orientation and alignment sequences - **Log file**
